alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 6:29PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Kit Carson County through 715 PM MDT... At 628 PM MDT, the public reported a strong thunderstorm near Flagler, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Mesonet. A weather observation system in Flagler reported a 45 mph wind gust. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Seibert around 645 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Vona and Stratton. This includes Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 391 and 423. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This thunderstorm will produce strong winds resulting in areas of near zero visibility in blowing dirt. Use extreme caution if you must travel and be alert for rapidly changing visibility. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Goodland.
